summary: the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) is the central site of cellular metabolism and protein synthesis. misfolded proteins accumulate in the ER and cause ER stress. the cell will activate several signaling pathways known as the unfolded protein response (UPR) (1, 2). phosphorylation of eIF2 results in the shutdown of global cellular protein synthesis and a reduction of the protein load in the ER (1, 6) but enhances the translation of the activating transcription factor ATF4 which activates genes involved in metabolism, oxidative stress, and apoptosis (6, 7). apoptosis leads to the rapid disassembly of cellular structures and organelles. double-membrane vesicles, the coronavirus RNA synthesis site and virus envelopes are derived from the ER membrane (15, 16) the extensive use of the ER membrane usually overloads the ER and triggers UPR. several reports have shown that IBV infection induces caspase-dependent apoptosis at late stages of infection in cultured cells. -ATF4-GADD153 pathway is activated by IBV infection. upregulation of the proapoptotic protein GADD153 plays a critical role in IBV-induced apoptosis. Western blot analysis of protein lysates showed a gradual decrease in Bcl2 expression from 12 to 20 hpi in IBV-infected H1299 cells. however, the protein was relatively stable in IBV-infected vero cells. this discrepancy suggests that downregulation of Bcl2 during IBV infection may be cell type specific. TRIB3 is highly expressed in certain carcinomas, including lung, esophageal, and colonic tumors. the high basal level of TRIB3 in H1299 cells in our study further confirmed that the high expression of TRIB3 may be a common phenomenon in cancer cell lines. however, the induction of TRIB3 in IBV-infected cells may help to modulate both AKT kinase and ERK activities (28, 35–37), 99 cells transfected with siPERK, siPKR, or a nontarget control siRNA were infected with IBV at 36 h posttransfection and harvested at 16, 18 and 20 hpi. cleavage of PARP from the 116-kDa full-length protein [PARP(FL)] to an 85-kDa inactive polypeptide was used as a major biochemical marker of apoptosis. in cells transfected with siPKR, PARP cleavage was barely detectable even at 20 hpi, suggesting that knockdown of PKR dramatically reduced IBV-induced apoptosis. both PERK and PKR are involved in the IBV-induced upregulation of GADD153, which may in turn play a critical role in IBV-induced apoptosis. culture supernatants were harvested, clarified by centrifugation, and subjected to plaque assay analysis using confluent monolayers of Vero cells. levels of two IBV structural proteins, N and S, were similar in cells transfected with siPERK, siPKR, and nontarget siRNA. this indicates that deficiency in either PERK or PKR did not significantly affect IBV replication in cells. phosphorylation of eIF2 was reduced in 2-AP-treated cells compared to control cells at 8 and 12 hpi. eIF2 phosphorylation was not suppressed by 2-AP at 16 hpi. IBV infection causes ER stress and induces PERK phosphorylation. GADD153 exerts its proapoptotic activities via suppressing Bcl2 and antagonizing the survival kinases (ERKs) many viruses have evolved strategies to induce ER stress and to modulate UPR. identification of specific IBV proteins involved in induction of UPR would provide insights into the mechanistic details of ER stress-mediated cell survival and apoptosis in IBV infection. however, transient expression of individual IBV proteins failed to induce UPR. this is in contrast to data published for SARS-CoV and MHV (43, 45) a relatively high basal level of p-PKR existed in cells before infection. the high basal level of p-PKR may have masked the detection of IBV-induced p-PKR. p-PERK and p-PKR were noted to be reduced at late infection stages. patitis C virus triggers apoptosis through induction of GADD153 and ER calcium depletion (50–53); Tula hantavirus triggers apoptosis through activation of caspase 12, phosphorylation of c-Jun N-terminal kinase (JNK) and c-Jun, and upregulation of GADD153 (54); japanese encephalitis virus induces UPR and promotes cell TRIB3 can also bind to mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase (MAPKK) and modulate MAPKK activity by either a positive-feed-forward or negative-feedback loop. knockdown of GADD153 delayed IBV-induced apoptosis and slightly reduced IBV replication in H1299 cells. our study provides a fuller picture of the activation of the eIF2-ATF4-GADD153 pathway. this work reveals the proapoptotic signaling of UPR in cells infected with IBV and provides new insights into IBV-induced apoptosis.
